name: Maison du Fort

reviews.title: Sparkling room and hosts
reviews.text: As a regular hotel and guest house user, this guest houes must contain one of the cleanest rooms I have ever stayed in. Every aspect of the room and bathroom were spotless.

reviews.title: Fabulous Little Inn
reviews.text: Marielle was a sincerely welcoming hostess who had the ability to make one feel that you were a personal friend staying in her home rather than just a paying guest.

reviews.title: Loved the experience
reviews.text: Her nephew Charles was equally delightful and entered into a really informative discussion about Quebec life in the winter time, we are really considering coming back in the winter to sample it and will indeed ensure we are wearing all the necessary!
Merci beaucoup a vous deux
reviews.title: Friendly, Spotless, Pretty, Simple
This is the place to stay
reviews.text: My wife and I spent five days in Quebec City in May 2006, staying at the Hotel Maison du Fort, located in "the old city" just a block from the Chateau and the pedestrian-friendly Dufferin Terrace.

reviews.title: Beautiful Stay!!!
reviews.text: I highly recommend this Bed and Breakfast to anyone looking for a cozy, clean and romantic stay. The staff is very friendly as are the cats!!

Right in the heart of Old Quebec, this home built in 1850 really sets the mood for what will definetly be a beautiful and romantic getaway from the crazy day to day life that we all lead. Charles will help you out as soon as you arrive and be sure to go to the Vodoo Grill for some of the best steak you will ever taste!!!
reviews.title: very, very nice!
Loved this place!
reviews.text: My husband and I simply loved Quebec City and no small part of this was due to our stay at Maison du Fort. Mme Roy is a charming hostess and was helpful with all our requests, especially very good driving directions getting back to our home in Connecticut!

We stayed in Room 6, which was large, comfortable and simply beautiful, with a view of the St. Lawrence River from one of our windows facing the Dufferin Terrace. There is an album in the breakfast room that shows the inn in various stages of renovation. Quite an accomplishment and Mme. Roy is quite the decorator. Victorian but not at all frilly or over the top. Just lovely, really, and so clean and fresh. The rooms and hallways are decorated in cat-motif and much of Mme Roy's own needlework. So pretty!
reviews.title: Great charm and great location.

reviews.text: The Chateau Frontenac is very close by and we were within easy walking distance of everything in both the upper and lower sections of the old town, including the funicular that connects the two. Mme Roy gave us good directions to nearby parking where we left our car in complete safety for two days. I would love to stay here again, perhaps during winter carnival, tho'my husband, a lighter sleeper than I, would recommend a room at the back of the house to avoid the sounds of traffic in the night. (Not a lot of traffic, but the narrow streets and all the stone buildings seem to create an echo chamber.)
reviews.title: Just wonderful

reviews.text: Maison du Fort is well located, reasonably priced and clean. The owner of this cosy hotel is very friendly and helpful. We were lucky enough to visit Quebec City during the Summer Festival and were able to enjoy the great weather and entertainment fully. Airconditioning would have been nice but the fan in the room was adequate. The light breakfast/starter was tasty and a great way to start the day. I would definitely recommend Hotel Maison du Fort to other couples visiting this colorful city!
reviews.title: Great Quebec Experience

reviews.text: This was my wife and I's first trip to Quebec City for our anniversary. After reading reviews from here on Trip Advisor and looking at other sites (Frommers -- it has a GREAT section on things to do while in Quebec City, by the way) and thoroughly researching, we decided to stay at Maison Du Fort because of the cost and location. must say that the Maison Du Fort exceeded our expectaions. First of all, Marielle was a wonderful host.. wait, "wonderful" doesn't do her justice. She was courteous, helpful (like helping get the best route to the Citadel and finding good restaurants) and a very gracious host. Be advised that Maison Du Fort is like a hybrid of a hotel and bed and breakfast.THE PLACE IS GREAT!! ! In fact, the interior design of the rooms was magnificent, as can be seen on their website (----- ... look at the pics, they give you a VERY good idea of the rooms) Individual rooms, very nicely decorated... very very nicely decorated. By no means is it lacking in style, cleanliness and location. It was wonderful. We stayed in Room #5 ( we recommend it. It was a lovely blue room, with stonework on the walls... has a bay window looking out to the street with a small seating area, a nice large stand up shower and sink, TV with cable, VERY VERY comfy bed, and classy look to it). Word of note: STAY IN ROOM #5!!! Its great! and even though Marielle states on her website that there is a small morning starter like muffins and what not, you can be sure that what we found was MUCH more like a Continental Breakfast. It was great. Home baked Zucchini bread, coffee, tea and all sorts of treats in a nice sun room with a piano. We met the other house guests and it was all very nice. Where else can you meet other house guests and chat?? Besides Marielle, the beauty of the room, the big thing is the location... we were literally ONE SMALL BLOCK away from Chateau Frontenac, the Boardwalk and great restaurants down Rue St. Louis, and the rest of Old Quebec. So not only was it quiet at night, but it was so close to everything that it wasnt a trek at all to get to restaurants or shops!! This is my first review and will say that the reason why I am reviewing Maison Du Fort: because IT WAS EXCELLENT. Where else can you pay 175$ CDN a night in the MIDDLE of the tourist district, at the heart of everything and get a great room?? I mean, the Chateau Frontenac youre paying twice that, and without Marielle's hospitality!!! I have never had reason to review a hotel before, but after experiencing the hospitality and style and cost effectiveness of Maison Du Fort, I will recommend to all that if you want to experience Old Quebec City at the best cost, with a great classy room to boot, forget the Hilton or whatnot: choose Maison Du Fort.
reviews.title: Choose Maison Du Fort!

reviews.text: P.S. No, I dont work for her... it was just that good!
reviews.title: Honeymoon in Quebec

reviews.text: My husband and I just got married and wanted to do something different for our honeymoon. We decided to stay at the Maison Du Fort in Quebec. This little B&B is packed with old world charm. It is very quaint (two resident cats walking around) and nearby to many attractions. In addition, Marielle, the innkeeper, was a very helpful and gracious host. She was very friendly and went above and beyond for us. Although this hotel didn't have all the amenities of a larger hotel, the room was neat and clean and the location was excellent. We had a great time!
reviews.title: The Perfect Place to Stay!

reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a four day vacation in Quebec City. One of the highlights of our trip was staying at the Maison du Fort Hotel. The hotel is in an excellent location in Vieux Quebec, just 2 blocks from the Chateau Frontenac. Our room (#10) on the 3rd floor was wonderful. It was very spacious, very clean and very comfortable boasting a four poster bed & reclining wing chairs. Madame Marielle Roy was a very welcoming hostess who made us feel as if we were long time friends. She is a delight! We would not hesitate to stay in her wonderful establishment again when we return to Quebec.
reviews.title: Home Away from Home
Great place, great location, but don't use Mapquest to get there
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in August and had a great time. The owner was kind enough to actually come and get us in her car when we got terribly lost driving there from Montreal. A word to the wise: Mapquest or other GPS systems DO NOT WORK in Vieux Quebec because the street names (and directions) have changed and the database has not been updated. We got terribly lost, called the hotel, and the owner said stay there, I'll come get you! How about that! The place was very convenient to everything, clean and well run. My only complaint would be that the items put out for breakfast (coffee, muffins, juice) could have been more plentiful and replenished more often. But there are many place nearby for a more substantial breakfast. The area is very quiet. I would stay there again.

While the Chateau Frontenac looms large as the historic tourist destination hotel, Maison du Fort offers charm, comfort, and hospitality equal to none. From the moment we arrived, we knew this would be a special place. From the warmth of the proprietress, the coziness of the rooms, and to the friendliness of the 2 resident cats; it truly felt like home away from home. We stayed in Room #5, a spacious, charming room decorated in blue, with its own feline rendition of Degas. The inn is located in the heart of Old Quebec, within walking distance to most sites. We would highly recommend this B&B, and would not hesitate for a moment to stay there again if we have the great fortune of being able to visit Quebec City again.
reviews.title: Utter Delight in the Heart of Vieux Quebec

reviews.text: Over the Columbus Day weekend, my fiancee and I stayed at the beautiful Maison du Fort. Historic,enchanting and immaculate are a rare combination for a Bed & Breakfast. Owner Marielle Roy seems to have the recipe perfected. We stayed in room #10 and loved it. Even the lighting was conducive to romance. And in the morning a musical "Bonjour"greeted us as we enjoyed some of the best scones & coffee this side of Paris. In the magic that is Old Quebec,Maison du Fort shines.
reviews.title: My Favorite Bed & Breakfast

reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed in Maison du Fort for three nights in September, and loved it. We loved the location - close to the Citadel which is great for an afternoon picnic. The room was very - but not overly - quaint. The people were so nice and friendly. We would stay there again, and we have already recommended it to our friends.
reviews.title: Perfect for us!
This place is great!
reviews.text: We visited Quebec City over the Columbus Day weekend, which was Canadian Thanksgiving, and had a wonderful stay at Maison du Fort. The location is perfect, just steps to incredible restaurants like the Continental & Cafe Conti, also very close to the Frontenac but tucked away enough so that the street is quiet & peaceful. When you step out the door you can see the river and a beautiful park just a block down the street. We arrived late but received a warm welcome from the charismatic & motherly hostess. The muffins, breads & fruit each morning were delicious, and we also got some really helpful suggestions from our hostess for daytrips. My boyfriend & I stayed in room #5, which was absolutely lovely, and our friend had #9 just up the stairs, which has a tub..she was very happy with her room as well! This hotel deserves all the praise it has gotten on the site... it's truly attractive, a really nice home away from home. We will definitely stay here again.

aka: Maison Du Fort Hotel Quebec City
description: A few steps away from the Citadel, Château Frontenac, the Governor's Garden, the Dufferin Terrace, historical sites and the Convention Center, Maison du Fort offers the charm and elegance of its almost two centuries old home including modern comfort.This Georgian style house was built in 1851 by Charles Baillargé, architect. An ideal location for travelers interested in unforgettable attractions for the Old Quebec City. History lovers will appreciate our many museums and 19th century streets. Excellent restaurants in the area are available for all gourmet eaters; shoppers will enjoy nearby boutiques and galleries.European atmosphere and fine service await you at Maison du Fort...
